channel.title: What to expect on Yauaa - Yet Another UserAgent Analyzer
channel.description: Recent content in What to expect on Yauaa - Yet Another UserAgent Analyzer

item.title: Field values
item.description: Output fields The resulting output fields can be classified into several categories: The Device: The hardware that was used. The Operating System: The base software that runs on the hardware The Layout Engine: The underlying core that converts the ‘HTML’ into a visual/interactive The Agent: The actual “Browser” that was used. Extra fields: In some cases we have additional fields to describe the agent. These fields are among others specific fields for the Facebook and Kobo apps, and fields to describe deliberate useragent manipulation situations (Anonymization, Hackers, etc.

item.title: Performance
item.description: On my i7 system I see a speed ranging from 500 to 4000 useragents per second (depending on the length and ambiguities in the useragent). On average the speed is around 2000 per second or ~0.5ms each. A LRU cache is in place that does over 1M per second if they are in the cache. Please note that the current system take approx 220MiB of RAM just for the engine (without any caching!

item.title: Try it!
item.description: You can try it online with your own browser here: https://try.yauaa.basjes.nl/. NOTES This runs on a very slow and rate limited machine. If you really like this then run it on your local systems. It’s much faster that way. A Kubernetes ready Docker image is provided. See this page about the WebServlet for more information.
